<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Checks out.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wages and salaries got their <a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-wages-salaries-increase-8ce98ea3bcc14c4810eb5a1111e1df49?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest bump</a> in at least 20 years last quarter, the Labor Department said. Pay surged 1.5% in Q3 and benefits grew 0.9%, both much higher than the pace in Q2.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What that’s telling us: </strong>Companies are writing bigger checks to attract workers in this topsy-turvy labor market. With 10.4 million open jobs as of August, America’s workers have rarely been in a better position to command higher salaries.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Who is seeing a pay increase?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Many of the wage gains have been captured by lower-income workers in sectors like retail.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>This week, Costco said it was </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/10/28/1049980529/starbucks-and-costco-raising-wages-in-the-nationwide-competition-for-workers?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raising</a></span><span> its minimum wage to $17 an hour and Starbucks said it was raising its starting rate to $15/hour.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Walmart, the largest private employer in the US, now pays its workers an average hourly wage of $16.40.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Perhaps there’s no better example of companies spending more on workers than  Amazon. The company said Thursday that additional pay <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/28/business/amazon-stock.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">added $1 billion</a> to its costs last quarter, when it hiked wages up to $22.50 an hour in some locations and dangled bonuses of $3,000.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">There is a downside to higher pay:</strong> inflation. When companies have to pay more for workers, they tend to pass on those extra costs to customers in the form of higher prices. And when companies have to pay more for <em>higher-wage</em> workers, which is increasingly happening, the chance of passing this on to customers rises even more.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The inflation measure most closely watched by the Fed rose at the fastest pace in 30 years in September. US economic officials maintain that inflation will recede, but <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/29/bill-ackman-calls-for-the-fed-to-start-raising-interest-rates-as-soon-as-possible.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pressure is growing</a> on the central bank to raise rates to cool off prices.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CLIMATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/29/what-you-need-to-know-about-the-upcoming-climate-summit?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Haggis For Dinner, Climate Change for Dessert
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/29/what-you-need-to-know-about-the-upcoming-climate-summit?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A mural ahead of the Cop26 Climate summit in Glasgow" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/75bd6104a48747ed896e1b93b1c15a8c18a5fc68-1024x717.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jane Barlow/PA Images via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">About 25,000 officials from 120 different countries will arrive in rainy Glasgow, Scotland, this weekend for <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2021/oct/11/what-is-cop26-and-why-does-it-matter-the-complete-guide?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">COP26</a>, the UN’s three-decade-old annual climate summit. Government officials including President Biden, India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi, and a whole bunch of climate activists will kick off two weeks of negotiations in what’s being billed as the most pivotal climate talks...maybe ever.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s on the agenda? </strong>Discussions will focus on chipping away at national targets for greenhouse gas emissions so that the rise in global temperatures stays below 1.5 degrees Celsius, per the framework introduced by the Paris Agreement.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Scientists say that for temps to stay under that number, the world needs to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 45% before 2030 and reach net zero by 2050.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>However, a new UN-backed climate report said countries’ plans to keep producing fossil fuels means they’re “</span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/20/global-fossil-fuel-production-dangerously-out-of-sync-with-paris-climate-agreement-report-says?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dangerously out of sync</a></span><span>” with the Paris target. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Organizers got a little rusty after so many Zoom events and didn’t prep enough accommodations for everyone attending. Some Airbnbs near the conference are priced <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/glasgow-expects-25-000-climate-summit-guests-it-has-just-15-000-hotel-rooms-11635517039?mod=hp_featst_pos5" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">around $10k</a> for two weeks, making the conference inaccessible for anyone without a hefty travel budget.<em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/29/uscb-s-mega-dorm-is-an-architectural-horror-story?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
This Dorm Is an Architectural Horror Story
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/29/uscb-s-mega-dorm-is-an-architectural-horror-story?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Munger Residence Hall at UCSB" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/dd9d70d31d803bba4865da7f55f6fa47999b198a-880x604.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Munger Hall mock-up (UCSB)</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Respected architect Dennis McFadden recently resigned from his post at the University of California, Santa Barbara, because the new dorm UCSB is constructing is “unsupportable from my perspective as an architect, a parent, and a human being.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What McFadden calls a “social and psychological experiment” is the brainchild of 97-year-old billionaire Charlie Munger. The Berkshire Hathaway vice chairman and Warren Buffett’s BFF donated $200 million for the dorm...<a href="https://www.independent.com/2021/10/28/architect-resigns-in-protest-over-ucsb-mega-dorm/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">with the stipulation</a> that his blueprints be followed exactly. But those blueprints are wacky:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Housing 4,500 students in 1.68 million square feet, the building would be the world’s most populous dorm and the eighth-densest neighborhood globally.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But it would have just two exits, and 94% of students wouldn't have windows.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wth, why?</strong> Munger—who is not a trained architect but <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/buffett-partner-charlie-munger-has-a-side-gig-designing-college-dorms-11556807102?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">has designed</a> other university and residential buildings for funzies—envisions Munger Hall, as he named it, creating a “close-knit” living experience for undergrads. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“Everybody loves light and everybody prefers natural light. But it’s a game of tradeoffs,” he told Bloomberg.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>UCSB is scrambling to resolve a student <a href="https://www.sanluisobispo.com/news/local/education/article254877027.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">housing shortage</a> that’s led to campus protests. It’s a problem many universities across the US <a href="https://www.insidehighered.com/news/2021/08/13/campuses-anticipate-housing-shortages-and-surpluses-fall?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are facing</a>, as undergrads log off Zoom and head to in-person class.</p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
IN PARTNERSHIP WITH GE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Big Questions, Real Change: Healthcare Edition
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<a href="https://www.ge.com/news/globalsubscription?lists=brief&source=MorningBrewAds" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="GE" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://media2.morningbrew.com/uploads/placement/images/4024/1635277881-df8c0d0d6de5c448838a014de6154f7654d2d5d4-3318x1842.png">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How do you build a healthcare industry that works for a world that’s never needed it more? Well, there are a bunch of smart people working on that exact question as we speak. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In our upcoming second Twitter Spaces event with our partners at GE, we’ll be speaking to experts in the healthcare space. Hosted by our executive chairman, Alex Lieberman, the discussion will cover how data and tech are creating precision healthcare, helping healthcare professionals and health systems operate more efficiently, addressing inequities in care, and much more. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To be in the virtual audience, simply keep an eye on our Twitter. You'll get all the details on how to sign up and hear this, ahem, <em>healthy</em> discussion on all things healthcare. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the meantime, make sure to <a href="https://www.ge.com/news/globalsubscription?lists=brief&source=MorningBrewAds" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sign up for the GE Brief</a>, your one-stop-shop on the incredible things GE is working on. <a href="https://www.ge.com/news/globalsubscription?lists=brief&source=MorningBrewAds" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sign up here</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<!-- <![endif]-->


<!--[if !mso ]><! -- -->
<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/29/key-performance-indicators-october-30?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>More than <a href="https://www.axios.com/millions-of-boomers-retired-early-during-the-pandemic-4aead44b-9ef5-4510-8f1c-6fb3cc7faebd.html?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axioswhatsnext&stream=science" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">3 million baby boomers</a> were pushed into early retirement due to the pandemic, according to new research from the St. Louis Fed. More shuffleboard and 4:45pm dinners mean fewer workers available for companies desperate to hire.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“I keep it on my desk as a reminder of what motivates me—keep going, keep working. One day, I’ll be able to upgrade to a larger-size cube.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A handful of folks in the online crypto community, like blockchain lawyer Drew Morris, have recently been <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/tungsten-cubes-bitcoin-gamestop-crypto-investors-11635431036?mod=hp_featst_pos5" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">buying up</a> cubes made of tungsten, which is 1.7x as dense as lead and has prodigious tensile strength, the WSJ reports. Sure, why not.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>We talked with Hertz’s interim CEO Mark Fields about why the company bought 100,000 EVs from Tesla. (<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/28/hertz-boss-mark-fields-hertz-boss-mark-fields-explains-why-he-went-with-tesla-for-big-ev-purchase?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Morning Brew</a>)</p>
</div>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChecks out.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWages and salaries got their \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/business-wages-salaries-increase-8ce98ea3bcc14c4810eb5a1111e1df49?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest bump\u003c/a\u003e in at least 20 years last quarter, the Labor Department said. Pay surged 1.5% in Q3 and benefits grew 0.9%, both much higher than the pace in Q2.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat that’s telling us: \u003c/strong\u003eCompanies are writing bigger checks to attract workers in this topsy-turvy labor market. With 10.4 million open jobs as of August, America’s workers have rarely been in a better position to command higher salaries.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWho is seeing a pay increase?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMany of the wage gains have been captured by lower-income workers in sectors like retail.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThis week, Costco said it was \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/10/28/1049980529/starbucks-and-costco-raising-wages-in-the-nationwide-competition-for-workers?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraising\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e its minimum wage to $17 an hour and Starbucks said it was raising its starting rate to $15/hour.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWalmart, the largest private employer in the US, now pays its workers an average hourly wage of $16.40.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePerhaps there’s no better example of companies spending more on workers than  Amazon. The company said Thursday that additional pay \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/28/business/amazon-stock.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadded $1 billion\u003c/a\u003e to its costs last quarter, when it hiked wages up to $22.50 an hour in some locations and dangled bonuses of $3,000.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThere is a downside to higher pay:\u003c/strong\u003e inflation. When companies have to pay more for workers, they tend to pass on those extra costs to customers in the form of higher prices. And when companies have to pay more for \u003cem\u003ehigher-wage\u003c/em\u003e workers, which is increasingly happening, the chance of passing this on to customers rises even more.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe inflation measure most closely watched by the Fed rose at the fastest pace in 30 years in September. US economic officials maintain that inflation will recede, but \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/29/bill-ackman-calls-for-the-fed-to-start-raising-interest-rates-as-soon-as-possible.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epressure is growing\u003c/a\u003e on the central bank to raise rates to cool off prices.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAbout 25,000 officials from 120 different countries will arrive in rainy Glasgow, Scotland, this weekend for \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2021/oct/11/what-is-cop26-and-why-does-it-matter-the-complete-guide?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCOP26\u003c/a\u003e, the UN’s three-decade-old annual climate summit. Government officials including President Biden, India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi, and a whole bunch of climate activists will kick off two weeks of negotiations in what’s being billed as the most pivotal climate talks...maybe ever.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s on the agenda? \u003c/strong\u003eDiscussions will focus on chipping away at national targets for greenhouse gas emissions so that the rise in global temperatures stays below 1.5 degrees Celsius, per the framework introduced by the Paris Agreement.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eScientists say that for temps to stay under that number, the world needs to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 45% before 2030 and reach net zero by 2050.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHowever, a new UN-backed climate report said countries’ plans to keep producing fossil fuels means they’re “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/20/global-fossil-fuel-production-dangerously-out-of-sync-with-paris-climate-agreement-report-says?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edangerously out of sync\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e” with the Paris target. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eOrganizers got a little rusty after so many Zoom events and didn’t prep enough accommodations for everyone attending. Some Airbnbs near the conference are priced \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/glasgow-expects-25-000-climate-summit-guests-it-has-just-15-000-hotel-rooms-11635517039?mod=hp_featst_pos5\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003earound $10k\u003c/a\u003e for two weeks, making the conference inaccessible for anyone without a hefty travel budget.\u003cem\u003e—MM\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" (UCSB)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRespected architect Dennis McFadden recently resigned from his post at the University of California, Santa Barbara, because the new dorm UCSB is constructing is “unsupportable from my perspective as an architect, a parent, and a human being.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat McFadden calls a “social and psychological experiment” is the brainchild of 97-year-old billionaire Charlie Munger. The Berkshire Hathaway vice chairman and Warren Buffett’s BFF donated $200 million for the dorm...\u003ca href=\"https://www.independent.com/2021/10/28/architect-resigns-in-protest-over-ucsb-mega-dorm/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewith the stipulation\u003c/a\u003e that his blueprints be followed exactly. But those blueprints are wacky:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHousing 4,500 students in 1.68 million square feet, the building would be the world’s most populous dorm and the eighth-densest neighborhood globally.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut it would have just two exits, and 94% of students wouldn't have windows.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWth, why?\u003c/strong\u003e Munger—who is not a trained architect but \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/buffett-partner-charlie-munger-has-a-side-gig-designing-college-dorms-11556807102?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehas designed\u003c/a\u003e other university and residential buildings for funzies—envisions Munger Hall, as he named it, creating a “close-knit” living experience for undergrads. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“Everybody loves light and everybody prefers natural light. But it’s a game of tradeoffs,” he told Bloomberg.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eUCSB is scrambling to resolve a student \u003ca href=\"https://www.sanluisobispo.com/news/local/education/article254877027.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehousing shortage\u003c/a\u003e that’s led to campus protests. It’s a problem many universities across the US \u003ca href=\"https://www.insidehighered.com/news/2021/08/13/campuses-anticipate-housing-shortages-and-surpluses-fall?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare facing\u003c/a\u003e, as undergrads log off Zoom and head to in-person class.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:
